snippet: Two federal law enforcement officials suggested that the hanging of Otis James Byrd might have been a suicide, but other officials said it was too early draw conclusions.
abstract: Federal law enforcement officials urge patience as they investigate death of Otis James Byrd, black man found hanging from tree in Port Gibson, Miss; local sheriff says there is no indication that racism played a role and that preliminary indications are that Byrd committed suicide.

byline.original: By CAMPBELL ROBERTSON and RICHARD FAUSSET
byline.contributor: Campbell Robertson reported from Port Gibson, and Richard Fausset from Atlanta. Matt Apuzzo and Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Two federal law enforcement officials suggested that the hanging of Otis James Byrd might have been a suicide, but other officials said it was too early draw conclusions.

headline.main: Officials Urge Patience as Hanging of Black Man Is Investigated in Mississippi
headline.print_headline: Officials Urge Patience as Hanging of Black Man Is Investigated in Mississippi
